dt: {bc}to change or alter greatly and often with grotesque or humorous effect

pt: {sc}transform{/sc} {sc}metamorphose{/sc} {sc}transmute{/sc} {sc}convert{/sc} {sc}transmogrify{/sc} {sc}transfigure{/sc} mean to change a thing into a different thing. {sc}transform{/sc} implies a major change in form, nature, or function.

pt.t: {it}transformed{/it} a small company into a corporate giant

pt: {sc}metamorphose{/sc} suggests an abrupt or startling change induced by or as if by magic or a supernatural power.
{sc}transmute{/sc} implies transforming into a higher element or thing.
{sc}convert{/sc} implies a change fitting something for a new or different use or function.
{sc}transmogrify{/sc} suggests a strange or preposterous metamorphosis.

pt.t: a story in which a frog is {it}transmogrified{/it} into a prince

pt: {sc}transfigure{/sc} implies a change that exalts or glorifies.

shortdef: to change or alter greatly and often with grotesque or humorous effect
